remarks: In a friendship graph, two vertices which are not connected by an edge have the same degree.  This corresponds to claim 1 in [Huneke] p. 1: "If x,y, are elements of (the friendship graph) G and are not adjacent, then they have the same degree (i.e., the same number of adjacent vertices).".  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-Dec-2017.)
